newsitem.title: INDIA: Two-wheeler stocks brake Delhi fall. [CORRECTED 12:40 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Two-wheeler stocks brake Delhi fall. [CORRECTED 12:40 GMT]

text.p: Shares in two-wheeler makers powered ahead on Friday, braking a broader fall in stock prices on the Delhi bourse on Friday, brokers said.
The Delhi Stock Exchange's benchmark index ended 3.38 points lower at 766.10.
(Corrects title and text to make clear that shares in two-wheeler makers, not the car industry, were ahead on Friday.)
Brokers said most investors refrained from making fresh purchases and squared their positions on the last day of the current settlement period.

Traders said speculators and foreign investors mopped up shares of Hero Honda as they expected the company to declare a bonus share issue along with encouraging 1996/97 (April-March) corporate results.

"A steep rise in Hero Honda shares on rumours that company might propose an attractive bonus issue amidt excellent working results later this month was the main feature of the day's trade," said Ashok Arya of brokers S.C. Gupta.
Hero Honda shot up 41.00 rupees, or 8.84 percent, to 505.00 rupees.
Bajaj Auto, another two-wheeler maker, rose 5.00 rupees to 850.00.
Reliance Industries lost 0.70 rupee to 289.90 as speculators squared positions, brokers said.
